dictionary.title: plantParts

entry.name: ‎flower‎
entry.description: structure found in some plants (division Magnoliophyta / angiosperms) to support reproduction

entry.name: ‎leaf‎
entry.description: organ of a vascular plant, composing its foliage

entry.name: nut‎‎
entry.description: in botany, type of dry indehiscent fruit

entry.name: ‎rhizome
entry.description: modified subterranean stem of a plant

entry.name: ripening‎
entry.description: Jump to navigationJump to search process in fruits that causes them to become more palatable. In general, fruit becomes sweeter, less green, and softer as it ripens

entry.name: ‎seed‎
entry.description: embryonic plant enclosed in a protective outer covering

entry.name: ‎plant stem‎
entry.description: one of 2 main structural axes of a vascular plant (together with the root), that supports leaves, flowers and fruits, transports fluids between the roots and the shoots in the xylem and phloem, stores nutrients and produces new living tissue

dictionary.query: ('aerial (before flowering )') OR ('aerial (flowering)') OR ('aerial (fruit maturing)') OR ('aerial parts') OR ('branch') OR ('bud') OR ('bulbs') OR ('floral buds') OR ('flower') OR ('fruit')
('inner bark') OR ('leaf') OR ('nuts') OR ('peel') OR ('rhizomes') OR ('ripe fruits') OR ('root') OR ('seed') OR ('seedling') OR ('seeds')('stem') OR ('whole plants')
